task_summary: Pick up a bottle using perception-driven grasping, as demonstrated in the provided episode frames.

task_long_description.overview: The robot is tasked with picking up a plastic bottle lying on a blue surface. The contact sheet shows a progressive approach from distant visual acquisition (frames 0-2) to close-up grasp execution (frames 6-8). The robot must perceive the bottle, align its gripper, compute a suitable top grasp pose, and execute a gentle grasp. The scenario assumes a clear workspace, a single bottle, and a standard parallel gripper with visual feedback loops for robust execution.
preconditions: Bottle present and visible in workspace.
No obstructions or occlusions around bottle.
Grasp not pre-registered; active visual localization required.
stepwise_plan: Scan environment if bottle not detected.
Detect bottle and refine pose estimate.
Compute grasp pose using top strategy.
Align and approach bottle with precision.
Execute gentle grasp with minimum force.
Verify bottle in gripper after grasp.
success_criteria: No collision with surface or bottle deformation.
failure_and_recovery: Fail to detect bottle: rescan workspace.
Grasp fail: retry grasp after new pose computation.
Perception uncertainty: approach with lower speed and re-check alignment.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the bottle is stably detected in the gripper following execution of the sequence.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the bottle is visible to the sensors.
Scans area in raster pattern up to 3 times to find bottle.
Detect bottle and localize its pose.
Open gripper to pre-grasp width before approach.
Compute grasp pose using top grip for the bottle.
Carefully approach and align gripper to bottle for grasp.
Execute low-force grasp on bottle using top grip.
Verifies bottle is securely held after grasp.

failure_modes: Grasp is unsuccessful (slip, misalignment, weak force).
recovery_strategy: Retry ScanForTarget up to allowed attempts.
Re-execute grasp after new pose computation.
Abort if bottle cannot be held after three retries.
assumptions: All frames show a single bottle: no clutter or occlusion observed.
Instruction matches visual evidence; no sub-task or placement phase present in frames.
Active leaf and BT designed per actual bottle position progressionâ€”no place/retreat phases observed.

expected_success_criteria: Bottle successfully held by gripper after grasp.
